data.title: Excellent Mexican food!
data.text: This place started small..and due to high demand has expanded seating and continues to offer cooked to order fresh wonderfully delicious Mexican cuisine . Yes they serve your favorites but they also have some very tasty dishes you want find other places...give them a try you will be a repeat customer! Thank you El Centro for building out and continuing to stay Downtown Rowlett!!! We appreciate!

data.title: Tex-mex heaven.
data.text: Wow what a place I have nothing but praise for this place. From the service to the food in a word out standing. They go beyond that that is necessary to make your dining experience great. The food is homemade tex mex. the (ceviche) shrimp cocktail is to die for completely made by hand with pride  it's a family owned restaurant that takes great pride in the food & service. They now serve alcohol 🍺 for the customers that drink 🍹. They also cater. Please give them a try I drive 60 miles one way it's well worth the drive. Enjoy 😊.

data.title: Amazing tacos... but that's about all
data.text:
Tacos are one Tex-Mex staple that most restaurants serve bland. Not El Centro. Their beef taco meat has been seasoned very well. El Centro gets super kudos for their tacos.

IMHO processed cheeses, such as Velveeta, are the eunuch of the cheese world. Considering the amazing cheddar, jack and queso fresco available in most markets, processed cheeses have no place in a cheese enchilada or spread on a delicious taco. I do not enjoy processed cheeses, so I was not the least impressed with El Centro's processed cheese enchiladas.

Come to El Centro for their tacos, but bring your own real cheese.

data.title: B Day dinner
data.text: Very loud atmosphere, hard to hear normal table conversation.  Salsa & chips were mediocre.  Had Enchiladas TexMex tasted very plain.  Queso had a good flavor.  Sour cream sauce was okay.  Chile con carne tasted like it was from a can. Saw one of the servers reach into the chip warmer and grab chips with his bare hands, then eat one and lick his fingers. When i asked one of the servers to brings two tortillas,  i saw that he immediately went to the bar and began talking to other servers.   Never saw a mgr the entire visit. Very disappointing.

data.title: Great lunch specials
data.text: New spot for me. Bigger than i thought. Lunch specials menu was extensive. Everything was 5.50. I got sour cream enchiladas. One beef one chicken with Rice and beans. Nice and hot. Very tasty. Clean place and the service was good.

data.title: Not going back!!!! Ever!!!!!!
data.text: They have a poor food, chicken enchilada don't have flavor, rice need flavor, beans need flavor.  Server it was very good. But not the food

data.title: Nice little restaurant
data.text: A friend and I decided to try El Centro out for lunch.  We arrived at 12:00 pm on a Wednesday and were immediately seated.  We both ordered the sour cream chicken enchiladas with beans and rice.  The enchiladas were average but towards the good side, the rice was okay but didn't care for the taste of the beans which was fine since I usually don't eat those anyway.  The wait staff was efficient, bathroom was clean which a big plus.  This restaurant is a good edition to the downtown Rowlett area.  I would eat there again.

data.title: Nice spot to enjoy with friends & family
data.text: This is a really nice restaurant. It's small in size, but big on atmosphere !!! It's family owned & it shows with the very friendly staff. The food is good & the prices are good also.They do a buy one meal, get another meal half price on Thursday nights, on selected entrees.They also have a small outdoor seating area & serve free margaritas. They don't have a full bar yet, but was told about expansions coming this summer.

data.title: Passionate about service
data.text: When the previous hamburger joint that occupied this building closed, we were upset.......until we tried El Centro. This family owned and run restaurant are so passionate about great food and excellent service. Whether we dine in or take out, we are always satisfied!! Tacos al Carbon are the best in the Dallas area....and I could drink the salsa. Menudo is awesome too.

data.title: Favorite place in town!!!
data.text: We literally eat here at least once a week. I love this place! they have amazing food & it's all run by family. they hold the family tradition very dear to their hearts & want to make sure that you enjoy your meal & even more, the time you have in their resturant. The owners are the sweetest people alive! & their food is amazing. I've had almost everything on the menu, but my favorite is chicken con hogos :)

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
Great authentic food. 
Excellent atmosphere.
Las enchiladas are hella'fied.

I like being able to pick from the variety of mexican sodas made with sugar.

There are other mexican places to eat in town but I choose to eat at El Centro.

data.title: Downtown Rowlett location with great food and great service
data.text: We have only visited a few times but we have been impressed with El Centro each time we have visited.  They have quality menu items with attentive service.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Great food.
data.text: I have eaten there once or twice a week since they opened. Excellent food prompt and friendly service. I have tried everything on the menu and have not found anything I did not like.

data.title: Margaret Shaw
data.text: Food is always delicious! Friendly service, just what you want from a hometown restaurant!  The owners recognize us every time we visit! My favorite is the beef fajitas!

data.title: wanted to try the new place- glad we did
data.text: the new mexican food  place in downtown Rowlett is very good, family owned and operated homemade. I really like the enchiladas and the the homemade salsa was good as well

data.title: Best Chicken Enchiladas In Rowlett
data.text: El Centro is our family's favorite spot for Tex-Mex in Rowlett. The food is always hot and fresh. The salsa is tasty. but my favorite is the chicken enchiladas. Also try the tamales. They are yummy. Friendly service and great down town location.

data.title: Family owned and very friendly
data.text: Not the best Mexican food but it is a family owned and very friendly neighborhood restaurant in Rowlett.

data.title: A Tex Mex Restaurant you can count on time after time.
data.text:
My husband and I love this restaurant and have not been disappointed when we have eaten here.  
The menu has lots of choices for good, predictable Tex Mex dishes.  The chips and salsa are really good, and I LOVE salsa and don't say that easily!!
I love the enchiladas, husband loves the tamales.
Some weekend nights you do have to wait a long while for a table, so go prepared especially if you have young children with you.  But the wait has been worth it to us.

data.title: Good food & good atmosphere
data.text: Tacos were exceptional. Enchiladas and tamales were also tasty. Outstanding service from a great staff. Definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Mexican Food
data.text: great food and friendly staff the food was good, a little expensive for lunch on Sunday but reasonable lunch prices for week days
